body: How did you determine that they are redundant? No related code changes?

+1 .. sorry for the missed timing.

Looks good Oleg  , is it possible to get all three relation from db in single query viz 
 get attachments 
 get monitors
get LoggedBy

I don't think we have a query like that at the moment, we can try to load all relations by namespace and then split them by relations name, but I am afraid overhead to get all the unneeded relations (remember that we have to load "from" and "to" cis for each relation separately anyway by running extra queries internally) would be more significant than 3 separate queries.
Ok , there is a similar need in getting  this to work  for work orders. Lets discuss more .
Makes sense.  I can put it back and I will make sure the bull check is in it too.
I'd really prefer not to check in a binary of Ruby, where was it downloaded from? How about downloading it with a script and checking whether it's present?

Merging.  This will "plug the hole" asap.   And we can investigate further and do a proper clean-up of message being "null" string for "delete" message types.

@sleepyorion fog 1.37.0 version does not have a dependency of fog-openstack gem but fog 1.38.0 has this. we need to make this change in order to execute an action procedure in our storage component. here is the related PR. https://github.com/oneops/circuit-oneops-1/pull/917/files

For example,  a request like this (to update value of one attribute [**module_version**] and _owner_  value of another attributes [**options**]):

> curl .../ORG/assemblies/ASSEMBLY/transition/environments/ENV/platforms/PLATFORM/components/COMPONENT.json -X PUT -H "Content-Type:application/json" -d "{\"cms_dj_ci\":{\"ciAttributes\":{\"module_version\":\"1.2\"}, \"ciAttrProps\":{\"owner\":{\"options\":\"manifest\"}}}}"

would clear the value of **options** attribute because its value was not explicitly specified (in _ciAttributes_).  This PR addresses this problem by preserving the original value during SQL INSERT.
removing unnecessary sleep and fixing killall such that it for force fill in case there are multiple processes running
closing this PR as this is not needed.
This PR is revert of #48

@ighouri @sureshg @jayeshpise   based on discussion we had 

* The nagios script should be changed in such a way that it checks multiple processes and stops all before starting. 
* The repair action in compute should fix and update the scripts. 
* Should be patched and fix for specific nagios version where the upstream does not have the fix
